bugs.title: CVE-2015-2688 CVE-2015-2689 tor: security fixes in 0.2.4.26 and 0.2.5.11

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2015-2688 CVE-2015-2689 tor: security fixes in 0.2.4.26 and 0.2.5.11

long_desc.thetext:
Several security-related fixes have been included in the 0.2.4.26 and 0.2.5.11 releases of tor:

https://lists.torproject.org/pipermail/tor-talk/2015-March/037281.html

Created tor tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1204774]
Affects: epel-all [bug 1204775]
*** Bug 1205237 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

CVE-2015-2688 CVE-2015-2689 were assigned to these issues: 
http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2015/q1/1001
tor-0.2.5.11-1.fc21 has been pushed to the Fedora 21 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
tor-0.2.5.11-1.fc20 has been pushed to the Fedora 20 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
tor-0.2.5.11-1.el6 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 6 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
tor-0.2.4.26-1.el5 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 5 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
tor-0.2.5.12-1.fc22 has been pushed to the Fedora 22 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
tor-0.2.5.12-1.el7 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 7 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
tor-0.2.5.12-1.el6 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 6 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

long_desc.thetext:
Several security-related fixes have been included in the 0.2.4.26 and 0.2.5.11 releases of tor:

https://lists.torproject.org/pipermail/tor-talk/2015-March/037281.html

Created tor tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1204774]
Affects: epel-all [bug 1204775]
*** Bug 1205237 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

CVE-2015-2688 CVE-2015-2689 were assigned to these issues: 
http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2015/q1/1001
tor-0.2.5.11-1.fc21 has been pushed to the Fedora 21 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
tor-0.2.5.11-1.fc20 has been pushed to the Fedora 20 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
tor-0.2.5.11-1.el6 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 6 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

tor-0.2.5.12-1.fc22 has been pushed to the Fedora 22 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
tor-0.2.5.12-1.el7 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 7 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
tor-0.2.5.12-1.el6 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 6 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

- "relay" remote denial of service under certain conditions
  https://trac.torproject.org/projects/tor/ticket/15083

- "exit node" remote denial of service under high DNS load
  https://trac.torproject.org/projects/tor/ticket/14129

CVEs are requested here: http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2015/q1/987

Created tor tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1205238]
Affects: epel-all [bug 1205239]
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 1204773 ***

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of Fedora.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

[bug automatically created by: add-tracking-bugs]

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=1204773,1204774

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for 

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi update submission link instead:

https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/new/?type_=security&bugs=1204773,1204774
Can this package be upgraded to fix the different vulnerabilities in the last release?

tor-0.2.5.11-1.fc21 has been submitted as an update for Fedora 21.
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/tor-0.2.5.11-1.fc21

tor-0.2.5.11-1.fc20 has been submitted as an update for Fedora 20.
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/tor-0.2.5.11-1.fc20
*** Bug 1205238 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Package tor-0.2.5.11-1.fc20:
* should fix your issue,
* was pushed to the Fedora 20 testing repository,
* should be available at your local mirror within two days.
Update it with:
# su -c 'yum update --enablerepo=updates-testing tor-0.2.5.11-1.fc20'
as soon as you are able to.
Please go to the following url:
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2015-4478/tor-0.2.5.11-1.fc20
then log in and leave karma (feedback).

tor-0.2.5.11-1.fc22 has been submitted as an update for Fedora 22.
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/tor-0.2.5.11-1.fc22
tor-0.2.5.11-1.fc21 has been pushed to the Fedora 21 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
tor-0.2.5.11-1.fc20 has been pushed to the Fedora 20 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

tor-0.2.5.12-1.fc22 has been submitted as an update for Fedora 22.
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/tor-0.2.5.12-1.fc22
tor-0.2.5.12-1.fc22 has been pushed to the Fedora 22 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

comments.text: This update has been submitted for testing by jamielinux.

https://taskotron.fedoraproject.org/taskmaster//builders/x86_64/builds/51114/steps/runtask/logs/stdio
(results are informative only)

(results are informative only)
This update is currently being pushed to the Fedora 21 testing updates repository.
This update has been pushed to testing

Still can't use firefox, seamonkey or konqueror through torsocks, but no
regressions.
This update has reached 7 days in testing and can be pushed to stable now if the maintainer wishes
This update has been submitted for stable by jamielinux.

Taskotron: upgradepath test FAILED on noarch. Result log:
https://taskotron.fedoraproject.org/taskmaster//builders/x86_64/builds/54892/steps/runtask/logs/stdio
(results are informative only)

Automatic push to stable based on karma has been disabled for this update due to failure of an AutoQA test. Update submitter, please check the AutoQA test result and see if there is a valid problem to be fixed here, and fix it if so. If the failure is a mistake on AutoQA's part, you can re-enable the automatic push feature for this update if you like, or push it stable manually once it reaches the requirements under the Updates Policy.
This update is currently being pushed to the Fedora 21 stable updates repository.
This update has been pushed to stable
